meanings.definition: In a disheveled or untidy manner.
meanings.sent1: She ran roupily through the muddy field, her hair flying in all directions.
meanings.sent2: The room was roupily decorated with mismatched furniture and scattered toys.
meanings.sent3: Despite her best efforts, she always ended up looking roupily after playing in the park.
meanings.sent4: The wind roupily tousled the leaves on the ground, creating a chaotic dance.
meanings.sent5: The old scarecrow stood roupily in the corner of the field, its straw sticking out in all directions.

meanings.definition: To make something messy or untidy.
meanings.sent1: She roupily tossed her clothes on the bed, not bothering to fold them.
meanings.sent2: The children roupily scattered their toys all over the living room floor.
meanings.sent3: He jokingly threatened to roupily rearrange his friend's neatly organized bookshelf.
meanings.sent4: The storm roupily swept through the town, leaving debris in its wake.
meanings.sent5: The mischievous puppy roupily dug up the freshly planted flowers in the garden.
